articles.title: Chinese Premier to Visit DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Premier to Visit DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Wen Jiabao, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China, will pay an official goodwill visit to the DPRK from October 4 to 6 at the invitation of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.

articles.title: Reunion of Separated Families of North and South Begins
articles.content:
Reunion of Separated Families of North and South Begins
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The reunion of separated families and relatives of the north and the south began at Mt. Kumgang Resort on the occasion of the Harvest Moon Day.
					Those from the north side had a group reunion with their kin from the south side on Sept. 26.
					
					When the reunion started, those from the north and the south exchanged greetings and news of their families.
					
					The Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society gave a reception for the separated families and relatives from the north and the south on the same day.
					
					Those from the north side had a family reunion with their kin from the south on Sept. 27 and exchanged their pent-up inmost thoughts.

articles.title: Food Donated by Vietnamese Government
articles.content:
Food Donated by Vietnamese Government
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The rice donated by the government of Vietnam to the DPRK arrived at Nampho Port on Monday.
					The Vietnamese government has so far donated food to the DPRK several times in connection with the natural calamities that hit it.

articles.title: American Guests Arrive
articles.content:
American Guests Arrive
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Melvin Lee Cheatham, special assistant to Rev. Franklin Graham of the United States, and his companion arrived here today by air.

articles.title: 28th Yun I Sang Concert Opens
articles.content:
28th Yun I Sang Concert Opens
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The 28th Yun I Sang concert was opened with due ceremony.
					An inaugural concert took place at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Monday.
					
					Appreciating the concert were Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, officials concerned, creators and artistes of the national art organizations, teachers and students in the field of art education. 
					
					Among the audience were the daughter of Yun and staff members of the German embassy here.
					
					Before the start of the concert Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, made an address.
					
					Taking part in the concert were musicians of the orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute and other national art organizations and the orchestra of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory. 
					
					It begun with female solo "Fog Creeps up Jong Il Peak." Put on the stage were Korean lyric songs composed by Yun the early period of his activities "A Letter", "Coloides Conores" for a string ensemble and small orchestra "Konzertante Figueren." 
					
					The concert will last till Sept. 30.

articles.title: Week of Chinese Film Show Opens
articles.content:
Week of Chinese Film Show Opens
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A week of Chinese film show was opened with due ceremony at Taedongmun Cinema on Monday on the occasion of the "year of the DPRK-China friendship".
					Present there were Paek Han Su, vice-chairman of the State Film Commission of the DPRK, officials concerned, creators and artistes in the field of movie industry and art and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					On hand were the Chinese moviemen's delegation headed by Zhao Haicheng, assistant president of the China Film Group Corporation, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming and staff members of his embassy and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					The speakers at the ceremony referred to the fact that the DPRK-China friendship is steadily growing stronger recording such meaningful, new chapter as the "year of the DPRK-China friendship" under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries. 
					
					They expressed belief that the week of film show taking place in Pyongyang and Beijing would contribute to expanding and developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples through multi-faceted exchange and cooperation in the field of movie industry.
					
					Then the participants watched Chinese feature film "Yu Gong Removes Mountain".

articles.title: Russian Chorus Gives Its Premiere in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Russian Chorus Gives Its Premiere in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Russian State Academic People's Chorus Named after M.E. Pyatnichki on a visit to the DPRK gave its premiere here at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre Sunday.
					Among the audience were Minister of Culture Kang Nung Su, Vice-Chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok who is chairperson of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials, creators and artistes in the field of culture and art and staff members of the Russian embassy here.
					
					The chorus put on the stage male chorus "Tanks Are Running across the Fields", chorus "Seven Sons-in-Law" and other numbers in which the performers truthfully represented in voice of great volume the Russian people's love for the country and their life and sentiments. 
					
					In dance "Dance with Whips", song and dance "Before a Fireplace," instrumental music "Valenki" and other numbers they displayed beautiful rhythms, smart skills, well-organized ensembles and refined musical technique. 
					
					They sang well Korean song "Arirang", making the performance conspicuous.

articles.title: Plunder of Farm Products by Japanese Imperialists
articles.content:
Plunder of Farm Products by Japanese Imperialists
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists are the sworn enemies who had imposed immeasurable misfortunes and sufferings upon the Korean people during their 40-odd-year long illegal occupation of the country.
					One of their pernicious crimes committed in Korea was the pillage of farm produce.
					
					The cunning imperialists enforced deceitful and gangster-like predatory policies including "Grain Expropriation Decree" and "Plan for Increased Rice Production" to ship a large amount of agricultural products to Japan.
					
					They, who had enforced the "System of Forced Grain Delivery" by force around the provocation of the Pacific War, stepped up the plunder of grain and other farm products under the cloak of "delivery".
					
					The grain which the Japanese imperialists carried away in 1944, a year before their defeat, under the pretext of food, industrial raw materials and military provisions amounted to 60-70 percent of Korea's total grain output.
					
					In order to depredate rice in an extensive way, they set up lots of predatory machinery such as "grain inspecting office" and "grain co-operative" in different parts of the country including South Phyongan, Kyonggi, South Chungchong, South Jolla and North Kyongsang Provinces, major granaries in the country.
					
					According to the curtailed data released by the Japanese imperialists, they took away 190 million soms of rice (one som equivalent to 150 kilograms), and, if added by cereals, 260 million soms of grain during their colonial rule over Korea.
					
					The Koreans who were robbed of rice were subjected to double and treble exploitation by buying negligible amount of rice at an expensive price under the name of "ration".
					
					The huge amounts of rice and cereals plundered by the imperialists during their colonial rule reach astronomical figures if calculated in money.
					
					Nevertheless, Japan has failed to make reparation for their crimes still today even though more than six decades have passed since the defeat.
					
					Japan must apologize and make reparation for all the crimes they had perpetrated.

articles.title: U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Censured
articles.content:
U.S. Hostile Policy toward DPRK Censured
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- A short while ago, the United States announced its "2009 national intelligence strategy". In this document it listed the DPRK as a "state threatening security."
					Commenting on it, Rodong Sinmun Monday points out that the document carrying the hostile policy toward the DPRK fully reflected the U.S. strategy for aggression on the DPRK, a strategy to stifle the DPRK and then put the whole of Korea under its control.
					
					The U.S. is not qualified to say anything about the issue of "security," the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					It is the hard fact that huge U.S. armed forces have been deployed in and around south Korea.
					
					The U.S. is stepping up the preparations for war while continuously introducing modern war equipment of new types into this region.
					
					Nevertheless, the U.S. posing a serious military threat to the DPRK designated the latter as a "security-threatening state." It is preposterous and as impudent as a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					The standard of the U.S. discerning whether it is a "threat to security" or not is based on the doctrine of high-handedness and dominationism, instead of guarantee for sovereignty.
					
					This is evidently proved by the fact that the U.S. named China, Russia and Iran along with the DPRK as "security-threatening states."
					
					As seen above, the U.S. is groundlessly branding as "security-threatening states" those countries which are against its interests and not in a political and military "alliance" with it.
					
					The "threat to security" touted by the U.S. is no more than sophism for making a pretext to attain its political and military aims. 
					
					The point at issue is that the U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy towards the DPRK and, on the contrary, is intensifying this policy.
					
					The reality goes to prove the validity of the measures taken by the DPRK to bolster its nuclear deterrent for self-defence.
					
					The U.S. scheme to realize its ambition for aggression on the DPRK at any cost, labeling it as a "security-threatening state", is bound to face failure for its criminal nature.

articles.title: Solution to Issue of "Comfort Women" for Imperial Japanese Army Urged
articles.content:
Solution to Issue of "Comfort Women" for Imperial Japanese Army Urged
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- Members of the Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps and other civic and public organizations in south Korea and victims of "comfort women" for the imperial Japanese army held a Wednesday meeting in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Sept. 23 at which they demanded the solution to the "comfort women" issue.
					 They condemned the Japanese government for having not yet admitted the crimes related to the past sexual slavery but evaded the responsibility for them. And they demanded that Japan stop the moves to distort its history and settle its disgraceful past history at an early date.
					
					 They also urged Japan to describe the crimes related to sexual slavery in history textbooks and institute a special law on the solution to the "comfort women" issue.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, the Citizens Council with Grand Mothers of "the Volunteers Corps", the Solidarity for Peace in Asia and Education in History and other civic and public organizations called a press conference in demand of opening to the public documents on such Japan's past crimes as the crimes related to the "comfort women" and human rights abuses.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Registered as Honorary Member of Peruvian Union
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Registered as Honorary Member of Peruvian Union
 Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian People's Women Union registered anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk as its honorary member on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of her demise.
					 A ceremony of conveying the certificate of honorary membership took place at the building of the union on Sept. 22.
					
					 Ruth Anchorena, general secretary of the union, handed the certificate to the DPRK ambassador to Peru.
					
					 Written on the certificate are letters reading: "The Executive Council of the Peruvian People's Women Union has honor to register Comrade Kim Jong Suk, a heroine of the Korean people, as its honorary member and issues the certificate of her honorary membership on Sept. 22, 2009, the 60th anniversary of her demise".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Laos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Laos
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- The Lao State Publishing House brought out in booklet General Secretary Kim Jong Il's celebrated work "On Firmly Establishing the Revolutionary Outlook on the Leader among Officials" on September 24.
					 The work, published on August 23, Juche 77 (1988), clarifies the essence of establishing the revolutionary outlook on the leader, the tasks and ways for firmly establishing this outlook and so forth.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Earnest Request
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Earnest Request
Pyongyang, September 28 (KCNA) -- It was on the evening of July 6, Juche 83 (1994) that President Kim Il Sung made a phone call to an official and stressed that the documents to be presented to General Secretary Kim Jong Il should be worked out as short as possible.
					The President said that every possible effort should be made to alleviate the work burden of
						Kim Jong Il, adding that he was the destiny of Korea, heart of revolution and banner of victory.
					
					The President continued to the following effect: Whenever I see Comrade Kim Jong Il working hard day and night for the people, I feel great pride of being blessed with the successor that no other leaders of the world have enjoyed, and have the urge to work more for him.
					
					I request you once again that you should faithfully uphold Comrade Kim Jong Il with revolutionary faith and pure obligation to the end and do your best not to impair his health.

articles.title: Visitara a Corea Wen Jiabao
articles.content:
Visitara a Corea Wen Jiabao
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ATCC) -- El miembro del Comite Permanente del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y primer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, Wen Jiabao, realizara del 4 al 6 de octubre una visita oficial y de amistad a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea por invitacion del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el gobierno de la RPDC.

articles.title: Iniciado encuentro entre familiares y parientes separados en Norte y Sur
articles.content:
Iniciado encuentro entre familiares y parientes separados en Norte y Sur
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Se inicio en el monte Kumgang el encuentro de los familiares y parientes separados en el Norte y el Sur, que se efectua con motivo de Chusok (fiesta otonal).
					Los familiares y parientes del Norte hicieron el dia 26 el encuentro colectivo con los de la parte surena.
					
					Ellos intercambiaron los saludos y transmitieron mutuamente las noticias familiares.
					
					El mismo dia, el Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio un banquete en honor de los familiares y parientes separados.
					
					Los familiares y parientes de la parte Norte se reunieron otra vez el dia 27 por unidad de las familias con los de la parte surena.

articles.title: Gobierno vietnamita dona cereales a Corea
articles.content:
Gobierno vietnamita dona cereales a Corea
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Llegaron este lunes al puerto de Nampho los cereales que dona a Corea el gobierno de la Republica Socialista de Vietnam.
					El gobierno vietnamita dono en varias ocasiones alimentos en relacion con la calamidad natural ocurrida en Corea.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Melvin Lee Cheatham y su comitiva
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Melvin Lee Cheatham y su comitiva
 Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ATCC) -- Llegaron el dia 28 por via aerea a esta capital Melvin Lee Cheatham, asistente especial del pastor estadounidense Franklin Graham y su comitiva.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena politica hostil a Corea de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena politica hostil a Corea de EE.UU. 
Pyongyang, 28 de septiembre (ATCC) -- En el reciente "informe de estrategia de informacion estatal" para 2009, Estados Unidos califico a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea del "pais amenazador a la seguridad".
					Este documento, que implica la politica hostil a Corea, refleja patentemente la estrategia de agresion a Corea del imperio para aplastar la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea (RPDC) y tomar en su mano a toda la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Asi senala el periodico Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual del dia 28 y continua:
					
					 EE.UU. no tiene ninguna calidad de hablar del problema de "seguridad".
					
					Ahora, estan desplegadas enormes fuerzas armadas norteamericanas en el Sur de Corea y su contorno.
					
					Los yanquis aceleran los preparativos belicos introduciendo sin cesar los modernos equipos belicos en esta region.
					
					EE.UU. amenaza gravemente en lo militar a la RPDC y denomina a esta como "pais amenazador a la seguridad", lo cual deviene un acto descarado igual con un incendiario que grita: !fuego!"
					
					La norma de ese pais americano sobre la "amenaza a la seguridad" no se basa en el aseguramiento de la soberania sino en la teoria del despotismo y el dominacionismo.
					
					 Lo muestra el hecho de que en dicho informe estan registrados, ademas de la RPDC, China, Rusia e Iran como "paises amenazadores a la seguridad".
					
					 EE.UU. tilda injustamente del "pais amenazador a la seguridad" a los paises que contravienen a sus intereses y no "cooperan" en lo politico y militar con el mismo.
					
					 La "amenaza a la seguridad", de que habla tanto el imperio, no pasa de ser una sofisteria para usarla como pretexto de la realizacion de su objeto politico y militar.
					
					El problema reside en que la politica hostil a Corea de EE.UU. no se cambia nada sino se fortalece mas.
					
					La realidad demuestra la justeza de las medidas de la RPDC que fortalece el disuasivo nuclear autodefensivo.
					
					El intento de EE.UU. de lograr su ambicion de agresion a Corea tildandola del "pais amenazador a la seguridad" no podra evitar el fracaso por su caracter criminal.
